But on Monday Chrysler rel="foaf:homepage" href="http://archives.thestar.com.my/last365days/default.aspx?query=Sergio Marchionne" target="_blank"> chief executive Sergio Marchionne said that industry-wide sales had fallen off in the final weeks of the month, which typically account for the bulk of sales. We've seen a softening of the US market in the last couple of weeks, Sergio Marchionne told reporters on a conference call to discuss Chrysler's fourth-quarter results. Sergio Marchionne forecast a sales rate of near 12.4 million to 12.5 million vehicles for the month.
